ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Zeb server maturing?
ygData.msgSnippet: All of the noobs moved to Paludal Caverns where they now bicker over bandit camps.  Luclin is really what changed the demographics.  Especially the Bazaar.
ygData.messageBody:
All of the noobs moved to Paludal Caverns where they now bicker over bandit camps.  Luclin is really what changed the demographics.  Especially the Bazaar.  Before the Bazaar everyone sold their wares in East Commons Tunnel.  But now it's so easy to get better armor and equipment that all noobs are twinked, they level faster, and now because of POK and the NExus, they can go anywhere they want without the aid of a druid or wizard so the planes and the higher level zones are becoming more populated.  If this is how it is just in the under 2 years that I've played, I can't imagine what it will be like in another 2 years.
 
Wulfric
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: mlockridge01
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, April 17, 2003 3:32 AM
Subject: [EverQuest] Zeb server maturing?

I popped into West Commons my last two sessions to see if I could bag
a giant. Just wanted to come back to the zone and do that, since now
I can. The place is so empty! Back when I was a teen it was busy,
laggy and fun. It is deserted now.

I have to wonder, are there very few real noobs these days? Has POP
changed the demographics in Norath? Places that were good fun and
fellowship are dead. Even Velious is starting to seem empty. Are all
of the players getting into the high levels and now living in the
Planes?

Barto Proudfoot
